article: Mr.Gray traveled a lot on business. He sold machines of various kinds to famers, which he thought not really a very  _  job, but he had always been interested in  _  , and he was quite satisfied with his life. He had a big  _  , and usually enjoyed driving it long distances, but he was also quite  _  to go by train sometimes too especially when the weather was  _  . He was a little frightened of driving in the rain or snow, and it was  _  tiring to sit comfortably in a train and look out of the windows without being worried about how one was going to get to the next place. One of Mr. Gray's  _  was often where to stay when he reached some small  _  in the country. He did not expect  _  and wonderful food, but he found it annoying when he was given a cold room, and when there was no hot water  _  good food after a long and tiring day. Late one winter evening, Mr. Gray arrived at a small railway station. The journey by train that  _  had not been at all interesting, and Mr. Gray was cold and tired and  _  . He was looking forward to a  _  but satisfying meal by a brightly burning  _  , and then a hot bath and a comfortable bed. While he was walking to the taxi stand, he said to a local man who was also  _  there. "As this is my  _  visit to this part of the country and I was in too much of a hurry to find out about a hotel before I  _  home, I would very much like to know how many you have here." The local man answered, "We have two." "And which of the two would you  _  me to go to?" Mr. Gray asked then. The local man scratched his  _  for a few moments and then answered, "Well, it's like this:  _  one you go to, you'll be sorry you didn't go to the other."
